etymology.description: 白 ("spring mouth") + 水 ("water") — water flowing from the source of a spring.
etymology.interpretation: An opening (白) marks the source, while 水 shows the flowing element. Together they depict water emerging from a mouth in the ground, a natural spring.

examples.chinese: 山脚下有一眼清澈的泉(山腳下有一眼清澈的泉)。
examples.pinyin: Shān jiǎo xià yǒu yì yǎn qīngchè de quán.
examples.english: There is a clear spring at the foot of the mountain.

examples.chinese: 这个村子靠泉水生活(這個村子靠泉水生活)。
examples.english: This village relies on spring water to make a living.

examples.chinese: 冬天去泡温泉很舒服(冬天去泡溫泉很舒服)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān qù pào wēnquán hěn shūfu.
examples.english: Soaking in hot springs in winter is very comfortable.
